page.title: 18BASILDON NE: DRUG CENTRE II
page.content:
The residents, when physically recovered, do various jobs in the house and grounds and sometimes locally, but receive no wages.
The family of the addict is given counselling whenever posible as frequently it is the family unit that suffers more in the long term than the addict himself.
The cost of running the centre is about Â£1000 a week, but it may well have to close because new government regulations effectively place an increased financial burden on the centre.
There are at least{50000 known addicts in this country, and about{1000 beds} in centres similar to{Still Waters.
